replies.bodyText:
this just let's the user express it however they'd like - it's not necessarily "right deep". If i write:
SELECT * FROM A 
  JOIN B ON b.id = a.id
  JOIN C on b.id = c.id
  JOIN D on d.id = b.id
I would get:
   ⋈
  / \
 D   ⋈
    / \
   ⋈   C
  / \
 B   A

The short of it is that I put the right expression on the right side and the left expression on the left side.

Really, it just made the code easier to write (I don't have to "flip" any of the expressions) and it gives more control to the user (which isn't a bad thing, given we don't do any optimizations)
replies.author: agavra

replies.bodyText: Nevermind... I just realized that these are the same trees. I Don't think it matters which source is on the left and which source is on the right in the join tree. I can rewrite it to always be left deep.
